Description: Papyrus (six fragments) written with black ink with demotic text on recto. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Thirteen fragments in one frame [...] Omitting the 8 small fragments on the left of the frame, the next 4 (9-12) are part of one document - a deed relating to land. [nos. 9+10 are wrongly joined together - two fragments are upside down - they should be unmounted, before they can be dealt with]. The remaining two fragments on the right bear date 'year 25 Chioak 22 of K. Ptolemy called Alexander'. Four witnesses at the base."
Curator's comments: Text 15 in Shore's Manuscript Catalogue of Demotic Gebelein Papyri in the British Museum. Publication in progress (C.J. Martin/S.E. Thomas).
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (321) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/321)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fractured, fragmentary, loss Black ink Backed: brown paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: cloth Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: B
